translated: Jātaka
The Collection of Eight
The Chapter on Kaccāna
The Cetiya Jātaka
“The one who is defeated by the Dhamma
does not defeat anyone else.
Therefore, do not defeat the Dhamma,
lest you be defeated by the Dhamma.
When one speaks falsely,
the gods depart.
The mouth emits a foul odor,

original: sakaṭṭhānā ca dhaṁsati;🔽Yo jānaṁ pucchito pañhaṁ,
analyzed: ca dhasati  yaḥ jānam pucchitaḥ pañha
translated: and one’s own seat collapses.
If, when asked a question, one answers it otherwise than it was asked, 🔽then,
if one speaks the truth,
may one be as one was before.
But if one speaks falsely, O king,
may one fall into the earth, right up to one’s shrine.
It rains for him out of season,

original: kāle tassa na vassati;🔽Yo jānaṁ pucchito pañhaṁ,
analyzed: kāle tassa na vassati  yaḥ jānam pucchitaḥ pañha
translated: and does not rain for him in season.
If, when asked a question, one answers it otherwise than it was asked, 🔽then,
if one speaks the truth,
may one be as one was before.

original: Musā ce bhāsase rāja,🔽bhūmiṁ pavisa cetiya.🔽Jivhā tassa dvidhā hoti,
analyzed: musā ce bhāsase rāja  bhūmim pavisa cetiya  jivhā tassa dvidhā hoti
translated: But if one speaks falsely, O king, 🔽may one fall into the earth, right up to one’s shrine. 🔽The tongue of the one who speaks falsely

analyzed: uragassa iva disampati  yaḥ jānam pucchitaḥ pañha
translated: splits in two, O lord of the earth.
If, when asked a question, one answers it otherwise than it was asked, 🔽then,
if one speaks the truth,
may one be as one was before.

original: Musā ce bhāsase rāja,🔽bhiyyo pavisa cetiya.🔽Jivhā tassa na bhavati,🔽macchasseva disampati;🔽Yo jānaṁ pucchito pañhaṁ,
analyzed: musā ce bhāsase rāja  bhiyyo pavisa cetiya  jivhā tassa na bhavati  macchassa iva disampati  yaḥ jānam pucchitaḥ pañha
translated: If you speak falsely, O King,
enter the shrine again.

original: Sace hi saccaṁ bhaṇasi,🔽hohi rāja yathā pure;
analyzed: sace hi saccam bhaṇasi  hohi rāja yathā pure
translated: Your tongue will disappear,

original: Musā ce bhāsase rāja,🔽bhiyyo pavisa cetiya.🔽Thiyova tassa jāyanti,🔽na pumā jāyare kule;
analyzed: musā ce bhāsase rāja  bhiyyo pavisa cetiya  thiyaḥ uva tassa jāyanti  na pumān jāyare kule
translated: O King, like a fish’s in the water,
If, knowing, you answer a question
otherwise than it was asked.
If you speak truly,
you will be as you were before.
If you speak falsely, O King,

original: bhiyyo pavisa cetiya.🔽Puttā tassa na bhavanti,
analyzed: bhiyyo pavisa cetiya  puttā tassa na bhavanti
translated: enter the shrine again.🔽Only women will be born
in your family, no men,
If, knowing, you answer a question
otherwise than it was asked.
If you speak truly,
you will be as you were before.
If you speak falsely, O King,
enter the shrine again.”
“The King was pierced by the seer
in the sky above the city.
He went forth to conquer the earth,
but he was defeated and returned.
Therefore, the wise do not praise
going by desire.
One should speak with an untroubled mind,
words that are in accordance with truth.”🔽The Chaitya Birth Story is the sixth.
